M.T.D.C.
Courtesy:www.doctorni.com Contact: doctorni@doctorni.com
1.See your doctor immediately if you have fever followed by rash that has red colored patches. Ask if a dengue test is necessary.
2.Fever increasing in the afternoon along with a relatively slow pulse may be typhoid. See your doctor immediately
3.Fewer irregular or missing periods without pregnancy may be polycystic ovary disease, which can be treated if detected early. See your doctor soon.
4.Suddenly developing facial or chest hair or deepening of the voice may be related to problems of the ovary. See your doctor at once.
5.Chemotherapy may interfere with your ability to digest milk products so you may experience bloating of the abdomen, diarrhea, abdominal crramps or passing of flatus.
6.Whether you have cancer or not, you must have foods that will actually help fight cancer such as ginger, green tea, Reishi mushrooms, and lots of water.
7.Standing close to someone smoking is also bad for your heart.
8.An infant's legs usually take on an M shape, the knees being the top peaks of the M, which helps hip development, and also helps carrying them comfortably.
9.If your infant starts shaking and trembling that does not stop on holding the infant close to you , then it may not be a chill but a convulsion. See your doctor immediately.
10.Condoms can tear if they are too old, or have been stored in a warm place, or in case they do not match the penis size or if the vagina is too dry or if a wrong lubricant such as vaseline is used.
11.If you are diabetic touch your feet everyday and check them for redness, or unevenness or eruptions or sores. Also take measures to prevent any injury to your feet.
12.If you have diabetes, ask your doctor to conduct a dilated eye exam as part of your eye check up.
13.Alcohol intake decreases sex drive, and affects sexual performance.
14.Pregnancy is less likely in the first three months of breast feeding after childbirth.
15.Children need more sleep than adults up to 18 hours for newborn babies, and progressively lower as the baby grows older.
16.Infants should not be fed honey under any circumstances as it may cause botulism - a deadly bacterial infection of the digestive system
17.Avoid mangoes, melons and pineapples if you are diabetic People with diabetes can eat whole fresh fruits that are high in fiber such as berries, apples, and peaches.
18.If you are diabetic you should also check your blood pressure regularly in addition to checking your blood sugarI.
19.30 minutes of daily vigorous exercise at least five times per week decreases risk of heart attack.
20.Laughing is good for your heart as it increases your circulation and decreases the risk of heart attack or stroke.

21.Chemotherapy may temporarily lead to loss of appetite, bloating of the abdomen, nausea, and constipation. But let that not lead to loss of weight or nutrition. Consult your doctor or dietician on what foods you can have to keep you from losing weight and help you stay healthy
22.Reduce nausea that follows chemotherapy by eating food that is cool or at room temperature
23.Sticky stools or mucus in stools may be related to amoebiasis. Ask your doctor whether a stool test is necessary
24.Both dry and excessively watery eyes need to be reported to the doctor. You should also see your doctor if you have puffy eyelids or if your eyelids droop or your eyes become sensitive to light.
25.If you experience abnormal milk flow from the breast even when you are not pregnant, see a doctor to rule out any pituitary gland tumour.

26.Excessive hair loss or balding in women may be related to hormonal problems, skin conditions affecting the hair follicles, menopause, or iron or vitamin deficiency. See your doctor to investigate the possble cause in your case and how to treat or control the problem.
27.It is generally 90% safe to have sex without contraception seven days before and six days after 1st day of menses
28.If you have frequent urination along with pain in abdomen and penis consult your doctor
29.If you are diabetic, avoid foods made with white flour such as white bread, noodles, sphagetti, pizzas, doughnuts, and cakes

30.Did you find our health tips helpful? For useful alerts on Diabetes, Heart diseases, cancer, women's health, reproductive health, or mother and child health, send your mobile number to doctorni@doctorni.com
